title: Plum pests and how to deal with them, by garden expert Helen Yemm
text:
Every week, Telegraph gardening expert Helen Yemm gives tips and advice on all your gardening problems whether at home or on the allotment. If you have a question, see below for how to contact her.

Plum problems

The ripening fruits on Jill Palmer’s plum tree have clearly had visitations this year from plum moths, who laid their eggs on developing fruitlets. Their tiny pinkish maggots then tunnelled into the fruits, ruining the crop.

There are things Jill can do in future: pheromone traps hung in the branches of the tree in May will trap male moths, thereby reducing the population slightly, but more importantly giving an indication of their presence, so that if she wants she can spray the fruit...
